channel.title: Canada on The Encryption Compendium
channel.description: Recent content in Canada on The Encryption Compendium

item.title: 'Five Eyes' Security Alliance Calls for Access to Encrypted Material
A Cryptography Policy Framework for Electronic Commerce: Building Canada's Information Economy and Society
Encryption Policy a Crowd Pleaser
item.description: Authors: Jeff Leiper Published: November 1998 URL: http://search.proquest.com/docview/217686754?pq-origsite=summon Abstract: At a meeting earlier this year by concerned industry players, the government was told that proposed restrictions were impractical because criminals had access to offshore encryption products. Further, the wait for a concrete policy was hurting business because companies were unsure of what they’d be allowed to sell. Shipping delays were costing money, officials from companies like kyberpass Corp. insisted. At the time, officials weren’t entirely frustrated.

item.title: The Five Eyes Statement on Encryption: Things Are Seldom What They Seem
item.description: Published: September 2018 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/five-eyes-statement-encryption-things-are-seldom-what-they-seem Abstract: Earlier this September, law enforcement officials from the Five Eyes intelligence alliance—made up of Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, and the United States—met in Australia and issued a Statement of Principles on Access to Evidence and Encryption.
